intro: Aframomum elegans, commonly known as the elegant cardamom, is a tropical herbaceous plant native to West Africa. It belongs to the ginger family (Zingiberaceae) and is characterized by its aromatic, clustered inflorescences and broad, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are followed by red or orange berries containing minute seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has a historical use in traditional medicine. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments and is adapted to humid tropical climates.
